Package com.esri.mo2.ui.tb

Several toolbars that provide a variety of predefined actions.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ProjectListener An interface for objects that request to be notified about ProjectEvents.
 

Class Summary
BaseToolBar A base class that provides common functionality for ToolBars.
LayerToolBar This toolbar provides actions that allow an end-user to add or delete selected layer(s) in the toc.
LayerToolBarBeanInfo This class is a design-time descriptor for the LayerToolBar bean.
MeasureGeocodeToolBar This toolbar provides several actions among others that are used for measurement and geocoding.
MeasureGeocodeToolBarBeanInfo This class is a design-time descriptor for the MeasureGeocodeToolBar bean.
ProjectEvent Sent to a ProjectListener whenever a project is either opened, saved, or closed.
ProjectEventMulticaster A specialized event multicaster for com.esri.mo2.ui.tb.ProjectListeners.
ProjectToolBar This toolbar provides actions that allow an end-user to open, close, save map project and print a map image to file The actions supported by this ToolBar include: OpenProject - Open a previously saved project file.
ProjectToolBarBeanInfo This class is a design-time descriptor for the ProjectToolBar bean.
SelectionToolBar This toolbar provides actions that perform feature selection based upon attribute or spatial queries.
SelectionToolBarActions The SelectionToolBarActions class is a collection of Action objects.
SelectionToolBarBeanInfo This class is a design-time descriptor for the SelectionToolBar bean.
ZoomPanToolBar This toolbar uses actions provided by ZoomPanToolBarActions class.
ZoomPanToolBarActions The ZoomPanToolBarActions is an action collection class.
ZoomPanToolBarBeanInfo This class is a design-time descriptor for the ZoomPanToolBar bean.
 

Package com.esri.mo2.ui.tb Description

Several toolbars that provide a variety of predefined actions. Each toolbar provides a group of related actions.

You can add one or more of these toolbars to your application to obtain the desired functionality. In addition, you can customize each toolbar by adding or removing actions to extend or hide functionality. You can also construct a completely new toolbar using a base class that is provided.
